Child Sexual Exploitation - Videos, Records, etc.
Child Sexual Exploitation - Videos, Records, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant William Joseph Hendrickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Penalty - Possession of Child Pornography], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Penalty - Possession of Child Pornography], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Penalty - Possession of Child Pornography], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Penalty - Possession of Child Pornography], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Penalty - Possession of Child Pornography], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No contact with minors. Can have supervised contact with minor family members with probation agents permission. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including sex offender treatment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

supervisions.notes: CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION APPLY TO ALL COUNTS.

from William Nick of Counseling Associates of Door County

Defendant William Joseph Hendrickson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Atty Reetz calls Paul Hyland to testify, sworn. Cross by ADA Grode.  Atty Reetz indicates they have a joint recommendation for sentencing, makes statement. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Alternative PSI

Defendant William Joseph Hendrickson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 & 20.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty.  Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties.  Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense not requesting a PSI as they have a joint recommendation worked out. Court would like a PSI in this matter, orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2017 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant William Joseph Hendrickson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz indicates matter is not resolved yet, hopes matter can be resolved prior to the trial date. Bond remains in effect.
from Atty Reetz indicating Dr. Miller concurs with Dr. Pankiewicz's report that defendant is currently competent to stand trial.
Jury trial on October 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Joseph Hendrickson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz indicates Dr. Miller has met with defendant and concurs with Dr. Pankiewicz's report that defendant is competent to stand trial. Court finds defendant is competent proceed, questions counsel on where matter is at. Atty Reetz requests a status 30 days out. State asks matter be set for trial as this case is a year and a half old.  Court will set matter for pretrial and trial. (4 days)  State requests a status to see where matter is at prior to pretrial/trial date.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 20, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Defendant William Joseph Hendrickson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews reports of Dr. Pankiewicaz & Dr. Kevin Miller.  Dr. Pankiewicz testifies by phone, sworn. Cross, redirect, recross.  Atty Reetz requests a continuance so Dr. Miller can meet with defendant and supplement his report. State objects. Court grants request for continuance. Bond remains in effect.  Competency hearing scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Independent exam done by Dr. Kevin Miller dated 10/16/16.
from Atty Reetz requesting adjournment of 12/05/16 hearing to give Dr. Miller time to supplement his report.  State strongly objects to adjournment.
Competency report done by Dr. John Pankiewicz
from Competency Hearing dated October 18, 2016
by DHS
Defense Exh.'s 1, 2, 8 & 9 offered and received.

Defendant William Joseph Hendrickson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Deborah Collins sworn, testifies. Cross. Def. presents exhibits 1 - 9.  Dr. Kevin Miller sworn, testifies. Cross. State recalls Dr. Collins. Recess. Back in session 10:38 am. Defense offers Exh.'s 1, 2, 8 & 9. Court receives Exh. 1 - Contract between DHS, State of Wisconsin & OUtpatient Competency Examinations, Exh. 2 - Evaluation of competence to stand trial by Randy Otto, Ph.D, Exh. 8 - video, Exh. 9 - Dr. Miller report. Atty Korb makes statement, asks court to rely on Dr. Galli's testimony. Court is not accepting Dr. Galli's report, makes statement on it's finding. Court orders Wisconsin Forensic Unit to conduct another competency evaluation. Evaluation is not to be done by Dr. Galli or Dr. Collins.  Bond remains in effect.  Competency hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
from Competency Hearing (Partial Transcript) dated September 15, 2016
Copy of letter from Dr. Collins to Atty Reetz re: her testimony at 10/18/16 hearing.

Defendant William Joseph Hendrickson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, inquires of defendant whether he believes he competent or incompetent to proceed. Defendant feels he is incompetent to proceed. Dr. Galli testifies by phone, sworn. Cross, redirect, recross.  Court adjourns matter today, will hear balance of competency hearing on 10/18/16. Discussion on how much time is needed yet. Court will set aside 2 hours. Family matter won't start until 10:00 that day. Bond remains in effect.
Email from VW Coordinator re: competency hearing
from Atty Reetz with dates Dr. Collins is available to testify.

from Atty Reetz renewing his request to reschedule competency hearing as Dr. Collins is not available to testify on 9/15/16. Court will take Dr. Galli's testimony on 9/15/16, will continue hearing to date Dr. Collins can testify. DTE.
Competency hearing on October 18, 2016 at 08:00 am.
from Atty Reetz as a follow up to his request to continue 9/15/16 hearing.
from ADA Korb objecting to court adjourning 9/15/16 competency hearing.

from Atty Reetz requesting adjournment of competency hearing for 30 to 60 days so defendant can retain an independent expert as to competency. Court responds: S & C filed 6/02/15, JT on 7/19/16 was scheduled in Jan. 2016 - 9/15/16 competency hearing set 8/15/16. Dr. Galli now subpoenaed for 9/15/16 - hearing stays on. DTE
from Atty Reetz requesting 2 week continuance.
Competency hearing on September 15, 2016 at 08:00 am.
by Dr. Galli
from Atty Reetz indicating he feels court should order a competency exam in light of some events of the last few weeks.

Attorney Brett E Reetz appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews letter from Atty Reetz re: competency issue with defendant, reviews State's response. Atty Reetz makes statement regarding some issues that have come up the last few weeks. State feels defendant then needs to be evaluated. Court orders the Forensic Unit to conduct a competency evaluation, removes 7/19/16 jury trial from the calendar.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 08:00 am.
from ADA Korb requesting a hearing regarding a competency issue.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Status conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
from Atty Reetz indicating he is still pursing discovery materials and conducting further investigation and analysis. Atty Reetz will be requesting an adjournment at 9/11/15 hearing.

Defendant William Joseph Hendrickson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews letter from Atty Reetz. Court questions Atty Reetz on where matter is at. Atty Reetz needs 30-45 days to look into discovery issues and further conduct his investigation. State has no objection with adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
